content:
PRIMARY KEY (vehicle\_id),
FOREIGN KEY (driver\_id) REFERENCES Drivers(driver\_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Drivers (
driver\_id INT NOT NULL AUTO\_INCREMENT,
name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
phone VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
rating DECIMAL(2,1) NOT NULL,
PRIMARY KEY (driver\_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Customer\_Requests (
request\_id INT NOT NULL AUTO\_INCREMENT,
customer\_id INT NOT NULL,
pickup\_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
destination VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
travel\_date DATE NOT NULL,
travel\_time TIME NOT NULL,
status ENUM('Pending', 'Accepted', 'Rejected', 'Cancelled') NOT NULL,
PRIMARY KEY (request\_id),
FOREIGN KEY (customer\_id) REFERENCES Customers(customer\_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Bookings (
booking\_id INT NOT NULL AUTO\_INCREMENT,
request\_id INT NOT NULL,
vehicle\_id INT NOT NULL,
driver\_id INT NOT NULL,
start\_time DATETIME NOT NULL,
end\_time DATETIME NOT NULL,
distance DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
fare DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
PRIMARY KEY (booking\_id),
FOREIGN KEY (request\_id) REFERENCES Customer\_Requests(request\_id),
FOREIGN KEY (vehicle\_id) REFERENCES Vehicles(vehicle\_id),
FOREIGN KEY (driver\_id) REFERENCES Drivers(driver\_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Customers (
customer\_id INT NOT NULL AUTO\_INCREMENT,
name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
phone VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
PRIMARY KEY (customer\_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Routes (
route\_id INT NOT NULL AUTO\_INCREMENT,
route\_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
PRIMARY KEY (route\_id)
);
```sql

The following constraints can be added to the tables:

- The Vehicles table has a unique constraint on the registration_number column to ensure that no two vehicles have the same registration number.
- The Drivers table has a unique constraint on the email and phone columns to ensure that no two drivers have the same email or phone number.
- The Customer_Requests table has a foreign key constraint on the customer_id column to ensure that every request is associated with a valid customer.
- The Bookings table has foreign key constraints on the request_id, vehicle_id, and driver_id columns to ensure that every booking is associated with a valid request, vehicle, and driver.
- The Customers table has unique constraints on the email and phone columns to ensure that no two customers have the same email or phone number.
- The Routes table has a unique constraint on the route_name column to ensure that no two routes have the same name.

## Populating Data
```
